title: How to Get an Uber Cancellation Charge Waived

steps.title: Open the Uber app.
steps.content: Open the Uber app. If you are not already signed in to your Uber account, sign in now.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It’s in the top left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select the trip you wish to dispute.
steps.content: Select the trip you wish to dispute.

steps.title: Tap Help.
steps.content: Tap Help . It’s just beneath the driver’s photo.

steps.title: Tap I was incorrectly charged a cancellation fee.
steps.content: Tap I was incorrectly charged a cancellation fee .

steps.title: Select a reason for cancellation.
steps.content: Select a reason for cancellation. Choose from one of the following options: [1] X Research source My driver and I couldn’t connect My pickup location was incorrect My driver cancelled The ETA was too long The ETA was too short My driver asked me to cancel

steps.title: Tap Submit.
steps.content: Tap Submit . Uber will review your request and get back to you within a few days. Submitting a claim does not guarantee that the fee will be refunded.

steps.title: Go to Uber’s fee cancellation page.
steps.content: Go to Uber’s fee cancellation page .

steps.title: Select a trip from the list.
steps.content: Select a trip from the list. If you are not already signed in to your Uber account, first click Sign In To Get Help and enter your account information. Then you will see a list of your trips. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select a reason for cancellation.
steps.content: Select a reason for cancellation. The available options are: My driver and I couldn’t connect My pickup location was incorrect My driver cancelled The ETA was too long The ETA was too short My driver asked me to cancel

steps.title: Click Submit.
steps.content: Click Submit . Uber will review your claim and get back to you within a few days. Submitting a claim does not guarantee that the fee will be refunded.
